references: Since the computation costs of the protocol are dominated by a DTAHE scheme. We give Table II to show the time cost of some DTAHE algorithms. We set the user number as

and implement three DTAHE schemes for comparison. The schemes are implemented in Python. The “pyOpenSSL” is used to implement the EC-ElGamal based DTAHE. The small discrete logarithm of a group element is found by the well-known “Baby-Step-Giant-Step” method. An open source library “bfv-python” is adapted to implement our scheme and the BGGJK-2 method in
. For simplicity, we use a public python module “eciespy” as an instance of the
scheme. The CPUs are Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8550U (1.80GHz, 1.99GHz) and the RAM is 16GB.
We use the “secp256r1” curve as the parameter set to implement the EC-ElGamal based DTAHE. For the security parameter
, the scheme constructed by the BGGJK-2 method in
according to the parameter table in

bits. The time costs of the three implementations are listed in the table II, which are measured in seconds. Apparently, a secure linear aggregation protocol with the EC-ElGamal based DTAHE takes the least time on user side. The protocol with our DTAHE scheme takes the least time on server side.
